title: John sold his watch for Rs. 301 and lost 14% on it. What is the cost prize of the watch? - Quora

response.answer_text: Statement of the given problem,John sold his watch for Rs. 301 and lost 14% on it. What is the cost prize of the watch?Let C denotes the cost-price of the given watch.Hence from above data we get as follows,(1 - 14/100)*C = 301or (86/100)*C = 301 or C = 301*100/86 = 350 (Rs) [Ans]
John sold the watch at 14% loss which means he sold it at (100-14=) 86% of cost price. so,86%=301 100%= 301× 100/86 = 350 p.s. 301=43×7 and 86= 43×2 so the cost price is 350.
